pylint.description: Module missing one or more of the four standard __future__ imports (absolute_import, division, print_function, unicode_literals)
pylint.fix: Add: from __future__ import absolute_import, division, print_function, unicode_literals

pylint.description: print used as a statement instead of a function call
pylint.fix: Convert to print() function call; handle trailing comma as end='' parameter

pylint.description: Old except syntax 'except ExceptionType, variable:' with comma instead of 'as'
pylint.fix: Replace comma with 'as': except ExceptionType as variable:

pylint.description: dict.iteritems(), dict.iterkeys(), or dict.itervalues() removed in Python 3
basestring or unicode type references (removed in Python 3)
pylint.fix: Replace basestring with str or (str, bytes) for isinstance checks; replace unicode with str

pylint.description: long type reference (removed in Python 3; int handles arbitrary precision)
pylint.fix: Replace long with int; remove isinstance checks against long

pylint.description: Long integer literal with L suffix (SyntaxError in Python 3)
pylint.fix: Remove the L suffix; Python 3 int handles arbitrary precision

pylint.description: Import of a removed/renamed stdlib module (cPickle, cStringIO, ConfigParser, Queue, etc.)
pylint.fix: Update to Python 3 module names (see inventory for per-module mappings)

pylint.description: Implicit relative import without leading dot
pylint.fix: Add leading dot: from .module import X; or use absolute import with full package path

pylint.description: ord() on byte data is unnecessary in Python 3 (bytes[i] returns int directly)
pylint.fix: Remove the ord() wrapper; access bytes elements directly for int values

flake8.description: Binary protocol module missing explicit binary mode in file open()
flake8.fix: Add explicit 'rb'/'wb' mode argument to open()/file() calls in modules that import struct or socket

flake8.description: pickle/cPickle dump/dumps called without explicit protocol version
flake8.fix: Add protocol=2 for cross-version compat or protocol=pickle.HIGHEST_PROTOCOL for Py3-only

flake8.description: String literal concatenated with bytes variable (TypeError in Python 3)
flake8.fix: Change string literals to bytes literals (b"...") when concatenating with struct.pack() or recv() results

flake8.description: Socket recv() result used without decode() or explicit bytes handling
flake8.fix: Add .decode() for text protocols, or handle as bytes for binary protocols

gate_criteria: All .py files have the four __future__ imports
No Py2-only stdlib imports remain (flagged, not necessarily fixed)
No implicit relative imports remain (flagged, not necessarily fixed)
No pycrypto in requirements (replaced with pycryptodome)
Characterization tests exist for high/critical-risk modules

inventory_categories_covered: All phase 3 categories plus standard pylint import-error and syntax-error
phase4.notes: Phase 4 adds standard pylint checks (import-error, syntax-error) to validate the migrated code actually parses and imports correctly under Python 3. The remaining 109 issues from the inventory (e.g. __cmp__, __nonzero__, exec statement, tuple param unpacking) require manual review and are not covered by automated lint rules.

uncovered_categories.description: Py2-ism categories from the inventory that are NOT covered by the custom lint rules. These require manual code review.

categories.name: SYNTAX_RAISE_TWO_ARG
categories.reason: Requires Py2 parser to detect; AST-level detection unreliable under Py3 parser

categories.name: SYNTAX_EXEC_STATEMENT
categories.reason: exec is a function in Py3; distinguishing statement from function call requires source text analysis

categories.name: SYNTAX_BACKTICK_REPR
categories.reason: SyntaxError under Py3 parser; will be caught by syntax-error check in phase4

categories.name: SYNTAX_DIAMOND_OPERATOR
categories.reason: SyntaxError under Py3 parser; will be caught by syntax-error check in phase4

categories.name: SYNTAX_OCTAL_LITERAL
categories.reason: SyntaxError under Py3 parser; will be caught by syntax-error check in phase4

categories.name: SEMANTIC_METACLASS_ATTR
categories.reason: Semantic change requiring class rewrite; manual review only

categories.name: SEMANTIC_CMP
categories.reason: Protocol change (__cmp__ -> __lt__/__eq__); requires careful manual migration

categories.name: SEMANTIC_NONZERO
categories.reason: Rename __nonzero__ to __bool__; low count, manual fix

categories.name: SEMANTIC_DIV
categories.reason: Rename __div__ to __truediv__; low count, manual fix

categories.name: SEMANTIC_INTEGER_DIVISION
categories.reason: Context-dependent: / vs // decision requires understanding intent

categories.name: SEMANTIC_RAW_INPUT
categories.reason: Simple rename; low count, manual fix

categories.name: SEMANTIC_REDUCE
categories.reason: Moved to functools; manual import addition

categories.name: SEMANTIC_ITERATOR_NEXT
categories.reason: obj.next() -> next(obj); low count, manual fix

categories.name: SEMANTIC_MAP_FILTER_LIST
categories.reason: Context-dependent: wrap in list() or use comprehension

categories.name: SEMANTIC_OPERATOR_REMOVED
categories.reason: Multiple operator module functions; manual fix

categories.name: SEMANTIC_COPY_REG
categories.reason: copy_reg -> copyreg; covered by W9009 import check

categories.name: SEMANTIC_MD5_SHA_MODULES
categories.reason: md5/sha -> hashlib; covered by W9009 import check
